title: Is he talking about lee sin?

embed.description: Tonight's red post collection includes a heads up on the extra bonus RP promotion coming in mid January, Meddler chatting about Aatrox and Shen's theme and abilities, and more! Continue reading for more information! In January, Riot will be hosting another extra bonus RP promotion!

body:
In response to the suggestion of making Shen a sort of tank / assassin, Meddler commented:

"While I can see the appeal as the Shen player I don't feel tank/assassin's an appropriate combination for the game. Tanks go straight into a fight, have natural survivability, sustained damage patterns, team utility/CC and are usually not attractive targets to try and take down if you've got any better options. Assassins by contrast tend to flank, have extremely high target selection and burst, low team utility, lack constant survivability (instead relying on other tools like mobility, untargetability, stealth etc) and are usually great targets to kill if you can focus them. **Combining those two categories risks creating very tanky, mobile champions with high CC/utility that set up their own kills, are extremely hard to take down and will happily chew through an entire team.**

Troll Rito at his finest. 

http://www.surrenderat20.net/2014/12/red-post-collection-extra-bonus-rp.html

I would say shen has an unfortunate ultimate.  You see your adc getting ready to fight in lane, you head down.  You ult down getting maybe a kill, maybe not.  If you don't, you went down there for a little farm if the adc lets you.  Then you realize that riven or whatever stupid fast pushers are laning against you, have pushed two waves worth of experience and gold.  One if you take teleport, which is required, but stupid because you can already go anywhere with your r.   But if you don't take it you lose lane if a gank bot at level 6 doesn't work.

That means that you can't take battle spells like exhaust or ignite because of teleport, and the increasingly important flash spell.

Not to say he isn't good in a coordinated team.   Eventually he gets so tanky that it doesn't matter.  It just feels like his e is a better spell than his r.  If I wanted to play a character to support the adc, I would have picked something like lulu or kayle, who have better support ults than uber tank shen, and sticking bot most the game means.

This is a good idea though.  What if shen dropped a blade anywhere on the map, that gave a smaller shield in an area around it, that he could jump to if he needed to with the channel.  And if someone clicked on the blade they would switch spots with him.  That would send someone top to take the farm and exp and keep the lane from over pushing, and shen could take the place of the support.

That would be wicked and could even be used in team fights to allow an adc to re-position himself.
